image.altText: Red, orange and pink light shimmering against the night sky.

props.synopsis: Stargazers were treated to another light show as the Aurora Australis again revealed itself in the skies above South Australia and Tasmania in the early hours of Saturday.

title.children: Aurora Australis goes 'berserk' across South Australian and Tasmanian skies

image.altText: Two women's soccer teams and mascots walking out to play a match.

props.synopsis: Stadium construction is a costly exercise, especially for cash-strapped sporting leagues and clubs, leading to a growing number of cities and teams around the world exploring a potentially vastly cheaper alternative â€” so-called 'modular stadiums'.

title.children: Stadiums can be political footballs, but could built-to-order grandstands solve the problem?

image.altText: Dan Cregan looks.

props.synopsis: Cabinet reshuffles can be akin to a game of Snakes and Ladders as all moves were on display in this week's rejig of the South Australian cabinet, writes Rory McClaren.

title.children: SA's cabinet reshuffle sees political players climb, slide backwards or fall off the board entirely

image.altText: Emergency personnel on the side of a highway near a flipped car, a bus and police vehicles.

props.synopsis: Police say the Mitchell Highway collision occurred shortly after they abandoned the pursuit of a domestic violence suspect. He died in the crash and the bus driver is being praised for potentially saving the lives of her passengers.

title.children: Domestic violence incident led to highway pursuit before deadly head-on crash with bus, police say

image.altText: Elon Musk has a serious expression as he looks to his right and clasps his hands together.

props.synopsis: Politicians from across the country have repeatedly called on social media companies to take down any content that risks further inflaming rising tensions.

title.children: Elon Musk refuses to take down tweets referencing Wakeley bishop stabbing

image.altText: An aerial shot shows rows of houses.

props.synopsis: Property investors in New Zealand have had several years with a reduced ability to claim their interest payments as a tax deduction, but the new Coalition government has brought it back.

title.children: In NZ, negative gearing was slashed years ago. This is what happened to first home buyers

image.altText: An animated graphic of two people (silhouetted) standing with three large radomes in the distance.

props.synopsis: In the 1960s Alice Springs saw an economic lifeline when America promised to build a space base on the edge of town.Â But once its bizarre, oversized golf ball-like structures were built, mysterious things started happening.

title.children: In a secluded desert valley lies the most secretive place in Australia, where the US eavesdrops on the world

image.altText: Composite image of the front of Strathfield Plaza in 1991 and Westfield Bondi Junction in 2024.

props.synopsis: In 1991, seven people were killed when a man entered Strathfield Plaza with a knife and a semi-automatic weapon. For some, the Bondi Junction stabbing attack was a traumatic reminder.

title.children: A man murdered seven people at a Sydney shopping centre in the 90s. Three decades on, the trauma remains

image.altText: dark ominous clouds over houses in the suburb of beechwood as a storm from approaches

props.synopsis: Australia's weatherÂ will serve up a smorgasbord of variability this weekend, with an expected drenching for the east, wintry nights in the southern states and ongoing heat in the west.

title.children: East coast to soak over the weekend amid possible cyclone, frosty south â€” and endless WA heat

image.altText: A plane flies over Kati Thanda lake Eyre and the water is hues of pink and blue against a blue sky and white clouds.

props.synopsis: An Arabana representative has welcomed the proposed plan, which would prevent people from driving, walking or boating on Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre without permission, saying previous misuse of the culturally significant site had hurt her elders.Â

title.children: Proposed plan to ban recreational access to Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre without cultural permission

image.altText: A young woman with long brown hair sits on a couch, smiling.

props.synopsis: Marcia Ryan was 33 when she disappeared in 1996, her car abandoned by the side of the Princes Highway in Victoria. Her family has never given up hope of finding out what happened to her.

title.children: New clues unearthed in 28yo mystery of missing woman Marcia Ryan

image.altText: Esava Ratugolea tackles Brody Mihocek as he tries to handball

props.synopsis: Collingwood has roared back after a slow start against Port to kick off a Saturday full of footy action, which will also see Carlton host GWS, Brisbane tackle Geelong and a Western Derby between West Coast and Fremantle. Follow live.

title.children: Pies back to their best in Port demolition as Blues face Giants test

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: The Pies might be back! They smash Port by 42 points
3QT: Brilliant Magpies lead Port by 35 points
HT: Magpies flip the script and lead Port by 12 points

image.altText: A Penrith Panthers NRL player walks off the field during a 2022 match.

props.synopsis: Penrith centre Taylan May is out of the line-up to face the Wests Tigers today, as the Panthers take a home game out to Bathurst. Follow live.

title.children: Panthers star missing clash with Tigers in Bathurst due to 'personal matter'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: Panthers take care of business in Bathurst
1' Wests Tigers kick off in Bathurst

image.altText: A light brown dog wears a grey knit jumper and sits on a grey blanket

props.synopsis: The international fugitive is settling into his new life in the UK after escaping animal handlers and spending weeks on the run.

title.children: Milo the Jack Russell reunited with owners in UK after escaping from Melbourne Airport

image.altText: A man in a suit stands at a lectern with an American flag, pointing

props.synopsis: 'The Mooch' got up close and personal with Donald Trump during his brief time as White House communications director. Now he's one of his biggest critics.

title.children: Anthony Scaramucci worked in Trump's White House for 11 days. He's disturbed by what he saw

image.altText: an image of a fire fighting truck on a street in brisbane with emergency service crews

props.synopsis: Several people treated by emergency services after a unit fire in Brisbane's inner city suburb of New Farm.

title.children: 'The flames got so big': Two people in an induced coma after Brisbane unit fire

image.altText: A photo showing Northern Territory police inspecting a hit and run scene in Birnkin

props.synopsis: NT Police said the 21-year-old handed himself in and is now expected to be charged with three counts of hit-and-run causing serious harm, after the incident left a woman and two men in hospital with serious injuries.

title.children: Driver arrested after allegedly reversing over three people sleeping on Darwin road

image.altText: People hold signs that say 'down with Israel' at a protest rally

props.synopsis: The comments came after Iran signalled earlier it had no plans to retaliate against Israel.Â

title.children: Iran says it will respond at 'maximum level' if Israel plans further attacks

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu in front of an Israeli flag

props.synopsis: The events of the past week have put the Middle East in a strange and uncertain space. Neither Iran, nor Israel would benefit from the prospect of an all-out war with the other, but equally, neither seems prepared to back down.

title.children: Iran and Israel are in a dangerous game of chicken, with a deadly prize for winning

image.altText: A tree in the foreground with a black grazing horse in the distance.

props.synopsis: Wagga's council says it found 500 slaughtered horses on a property this week. Now the NSW government has launched a multi-agency investigation into the National Parks and Wildlife brumby re-homing program.

title.children: Brumby re-homing program under investigation after mass horse carcass find on farm

image.altText: A female boxer is in the ring sparring by herself.

props.synopsis: Many athletes donâ€™t eat enough food for the amount of energy theyâ€™re outputting â€“ and that can lead to serious health issues and affect their performance.

title.children: Why eating enough when exercising is so important

image.altText: A man sitting in a doctor's surgery with a head wound a blood around the nap of his t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The attack on a Cambodian-Australian visiting his homeland sets a worrying precedent according to community leaders and prompts activists to cancel upcoming travel plans.Â

title.children: Melbourne man who criticised Cambodian government beaten with bamboo sticks during holiday

image.altText: Michelle sits in shadows to protect her identity.

props.synopsis: Coercive control will become a criminal offence in Queensland next year, carrying a maximum sentence of up to 14 years in jail, but survivors fear police won't be equipped to respond.

title.children: 'They just didn't want to go there': A woman subjected to coercive control for years says police will struggle under new laws

image.altText: A composite picture of a brother and sister as children and as adults.

props.synopsis: Would you go into business with a sibling? From a winery to cheesemakers, these Tasmanian entrepreneurs have had a crack, and it's paying off.

title.children: This brother and sister bought a farm together. Here's how they made it work

image.altText: Close up of Brittany Higgins with her head down.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lerhmann's defamation case has exposed a continuing hostility to women in the broader Australian community which has seen women too eagerly cast as liars, whatever the nature of the issue that has brought them to public attention.

title.children: The uncomfortable truth of how our political leaders responded to Brittany Higgins's rape allegation lingers

image.altText: A young man grips a football and is mid run.

props.synopsis: The Dolphins NRL club and Alternaleaf have been partners for a month but as of this week the online clinic is in trouble with the TGA.Â

title.children: Just one month after Dolphins and Alternaleaf teamed up, the clinic's cannabis advertising is under fire

image.altText: Two aboriginal elders stand on the front of court house steps holding each other and the photo of their dead family member

props.synopsis: Gomeroi teenager Mark Haines was found dead on train tracks south of Tamworth 36 years ago. Now the second inquest into the circumstances surrounding his death has been adjourned after possible new evidence emerges.

title.children: Mark Haines inquest adjourned, but more questions set to be asked

image.altText: Three women wearing graduation hats and robes outside a sandstone building at the

props.synopsis: High inflation means many workers' HECS debts are growing faster than they can pay it off.Â It shows why calls for change have grown so loud that the prime minister has all but confirmed there will be HECS relief in the budget, national education and parenting reporter Conor Duffy writes.

title.children: Large HECS debts used to be rare. Now thousands of us owe more than $60,000

image.altText: Snowboarder Alex Pullin kisses his gold medal at the 2013 snowboard world championships.

props.synopsis: The world champion snowboarder died in 2020 in a spearfishing accident at the age of 32. His family and partner hope a stadium named in his honour will keep his spirit alive in his hometown.

title.children: 'Beautiful' honour as stadium named in memory of snowboarding legend Chumpy Pullin

image.altText: Man standing at TechnologyOne office in Victoria.

props.synopsis: Behnam Roohizadegan thought he'd won a record $5.2 million payout against publicly-listed company TechnologyOne, but now the case is being retried, dragging on years of anguish he claims he has suffered at the hands of the big corporation.Â

title.children: Retrial set for TechnologyOne case that set record for $5.2m unlawful dismissal payout

image.altText: A police officer uses a fire extinguisher in a park

props.synopsis: A man has set himself on fire outside the New York courthouse whereÂ Donald Trump'sÂ historic "hush-money" trial is taking place.

title.children: Man rushed to hospital after setting himself on fire outside court where Donald Trump is on trial

image.altText: A selfie where she has sunscreen on her lips and two pairs of glasses on

props.synopsis: It has been described as one of the world's most epic cycling crossings, but Charissa Hanrahan found the high number of road trains and news of cyclist being fatally hit by a truck enough for her to redirect her journey.

title.children: Eyre Highway death gives cyclist second thoughts about crossing the Nullarbor for charity

image.altText: Two kids in green school informs, cricket pads, helmets and with a bat put arms around each other in cricket nets.

props.synopsis: Henry Land travels 400km to play cricket every weekend. But after posting hand-drawn flyers around town, the Cunnamulla kid's dream of starting a local cricket team could finally come true.

title.children: The barefoot band of bush kids on a mission to start a cricket team

image.altText: Gold coins with B on them.

props.synopsis: The change to the cryptocurrency's underlying technology is designed toÂ cut the rate at which new bitcoins are created.Â

title.children: Bitcoin's fourth technical 'halving' change is complete. What does it mean?

image.altText: Whitney and Danielle YunupiÅ‹u hold a yelllow football and look across the camera while smiling against a backdrop of trees.

props.synopsis: Cultural 'shame' can hold YolÅ‹u women back from playing footy in north-east Arnhem Land. Now women and girls want their brothers' backing in the momentum to restart a local league.

title.children: In a quest to play footy, these Arnhem Land women want their brothers' support
